definition[0]: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found
example[1]: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
definition[1]: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something final can be made
example[5]: Shareholders will receive an interim dividend of £5.03p per share
definition[2]: prepared after only part of a full financial year has been completed, often after half a year
example[6]: Interim figures announced yesterday show a 16% leap in pre-tax profits to £95 million.
